name: Gluten-free Chai Spice Shortbread
description: Some gluten-free recipes call for xanthan gum (fermented glucose) or guar gum (made from guar beans) as they have thickening properties that are required in the absence of gluten.
preparation: Combine gluten-free flour, xanthan gum, and chai spice in a bowl.
Beat butter until light and fluffy. Sift in icing sugar and beat again.
Add flour mixture and combine. Add vanilla extract and mix until dough comes together.

Spoon approximately 1 tbsp of cookie dough onto a Sheet Pan lined with a Sheet Pan Liner leaving 2 inches between cookies. Bake for 18–20 minutes, until bottoms brown lightly. Once slightly cooled, gently move them to a cooling rack.
